alert.note: Alert for Guernsey (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 11:02AM EST until February 20 at 5:18PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Wills Creek At Cambridge affecting Guernsey County.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC059-190415- /O.NEW.KPBZ.FL.W.0016.220219T0000Z-220220T2218Z/ /CDIO1.1.ER.220219T0000Z.220220T0000Z.220220T1617Z.NO/ 1102 AM EST Fri Feb 18 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wills Creek at Cambridge. * WHEN...From this evening to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Overflowing of poor drainage and low lying areas will result in minor flooding along wills creek. At 16.0 feet, Basement flooding begins through floor drains and other sewer connections. Local interruptions in sanitary service may occur along Gordon`s Run from 3rd Street to 6th Street. At 17.0 feet, Water overflows wills Creek Valley Road to a depth of 2 feet. Water reaches a depth of 1 foot on North Eighth Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 15.0 feet this evening. It will then fall to 14.6 feet and begin rising again tomorrow morning. It will rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue to rise to 15.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
